div.p: Folder 2, box 56, James Hector, correspondence received, Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa Archives, Wellington.

Having officially thanked the N.Z. Institute, dear Dr Hector, for the honor, bestowed so unexpectedly on me,
Honorary membership; see New Zealand Institute to M, 25 April 1871, J. Hector to M, 12 May 1871, and M to J. Hector, 4 June 1871. I now beg to offer my services in any way, if they can be useful to the Institute. Perhaps you possess in the Library there my works very imperfectly. Those which appeared in Melbourne, I may be able to send you yet all, if you will kindly instruct me about your requirements; altho' the 2 first volumes of the Fragmenta
B60.02.04, B62.02.02. cannot any longer be obtained, except occasionally by the sale of libraries.

The Moa is of no urgent consequence to the Museum, which asked me for it,
Königliche Naturalien Kabinet, Stuttgart; see M to F. von Krauss, 8 October 1871. more particularly as Dr Haast sent several fairly completed skeletons of various species to the Continent, where therefore any Ornithologist or Palaeontologist may study these extraordinar creatures of a past time now.
With my best salutation your regardful

div.p:
Pray let Mr Buchanan
John Buchanan (1819-1898). bear the fruit of Donatia in mind; also please ask for a specimen of each of the new plants just described by him.
The most recently published paper was Buchanan (1871) (parts read 25 June 1870, 22 October 1870, 12 November 1870; issued May 1871).

Do you require more Cinchonas, Cork Oaks, Chinese & Assam tea plants, Hickories, American Walnuts &c this season. Would it not be well to give the results of your experiences with them in the "transactions". I send copies of two prints herewith.
'Prints' not identified.
